item.title: Elden Ring: 20 Best Shields, Ranked
item.description:
It's no surprise that players worldwide believe that Elden Ring is GOTY material, even if there's still more content yet to be released like the DLC that some players have found evidence of before its announcement earlier in 2023. In the long wait until the DLC, players still have plenty of caves to explore, ruins to pillage, and ill-omened creatures to fell.

But, players shouldn't expect to breeze through Elden Ring since they'll need to use the best equipment to survive. One type of equipment that can prove useful in vanquishing enemies is a shield since it can protect a player from lethal blows. But, with so many Elden Ring shields to choose from, it can be a challenge to know which one is the best one to get the job done.

Updated December 24, 2024 by Erik Petrovich : In Elden Ring, Shields take many shapes and forms, and can often form the backbone of a powerful build just the same as a regular weapon. This is more apparent in the Shadow of the Erdtree expansion which introduced two new Thrusting Shield weapons, which essentially serve as a duo Shield and two-handed thrusting weapon. These items are unique as they allow players to attack and guard at the same time, but of the two, the Carian Thrusting Shield is arguably the more powerful. Though you can do a lot with a base Dueling Shield, the split damage of the Carian Dueling Shield makes it useful for certain build types. This guide to the best Elden Ring shields has been updated to include this powerful Shadow of the Erdtree shield, including a brief overview of the location it can be found at.

Even though small shields aren't the best at reducing attacks due to their size, Shield of the Guilty is an exception since it has 68 points of Guard Protection. On top of that, since it's a small shield, players can dodge attacks a lot quicker and easier without using too much Stamina.

Another feature that makes this one of the best shields in Elden Ring is that players can use the Shield Bash Ash of War which can stagger most enemies.

Elden Ring Shield of the Guilty Location

To get the Shield of the Guilty Elden Ring players head to the Demi-Human Forest Ruins in the northern forests of the Weeping Peninsula â€“ if you see Castle Morne, you've gone too far. Look for this shield just before the main building with the Demi-Human Queen mini-boss.

Players who want the best of a greatshield and a small shield will enjoy using the Beastman's Jar-Shield since it balances damage reduction and agility. Another reason why the Beastman's Jar-Shield deserves its spot among the best shields in Elden Ring is that it can be infused with Ashes of War, Magic, and other consumables.

The only problem with this medium shield is that players can only find it at Crumbling Farum Azula, which is considered the end-game area of Elden Ring .

Elden Ring Beastman's Jar-Shield Location

To get the Beastman's Jar-Shield Elden Ring players must defeat Beastmen of Farum Azula, but only the ones found in Crumbling Farum Azula near the end of the game. Players that wish to wield this powerful medium shield can farm it from Beastmen near the Crumbling Beast Grave Depths Site of Grace.

Even though the Fingerprint Stone Shield is one of the heaviest shields in Elden Ring, and even requires 48 Strength, it's a viable pick for any strength-heavy build. It boasts great defenses, 100% Physical block, and can hold its own against the most Stamina-reducing attacks.

But, one of the main reasons why the Fingerprint Stone Shield is one of the best shields in Elden Ring is that its Ash of War causes Madness build-up. Unfortunately, obtaining this greatshield is no easy task.

Elden Ring Fingerprint Stone Shield Location

To get the Fingerprint Stone Shield Elden Ring players need to defeat Morgott, the Omen King, and the alternate version of Mohg beneath the Leyndell Sewers. After beating both of these powerful bosses, players will need to go to the Cathedral of the Forsaken deep beneath Leyndell, and continue down a specific set of platforms that will eventually lead them to the shield.

The Jellyfish Shield is undoubtedly one of the most unique-looking greatshields in Elden Ring that most players may ignore due to its squishy appearance. But, this greatshield merits a place in this Elden Ring shield tier list since its Contagious Fury ability boosts the player's attack by 20% for 30 seconds.

But, the buff only applies to single-handed weapons, so players can't use its Ash of War and switch to a two-handed weapon, as it will nullify the effects.

Elden Ring Jellyfish Shield Location

To get the Jellyfish Shield Elden Ring players must go to the area below Four Belfies, specifically to a field west of the Belfries' hill. Look next to a corpse guarded by four Jellyfish, which can easily be reached by heading north from the Foot of the Four Belfries.

The Scripture Wooden Shield is the go-to shield for most players who enjoy using magic builds since it offers a modest amount of defense while still being light enough for players who avoid investing in Stamina. But, the real beauty of the Scripture Wooden Shield is that it can Parry a huge number of attacks from bosses like that of Malenia, Blade of Miquella.

Though the Parry Ash of War can also be bought and applied to other shields, this one is found soon enough that it's a useful shield for mages in the early game. Parrying attacks takes time and practice, so players new to parrying should practice on easier enemies before tackling larger ones.

Elden Ring Scripture Wooden Shield Location

To get the Scripture Wooden Shield Elden Ring players can farm the skeleton enemies found inside Deathtouched Catacombs. It can also be found later on in the Auriza Hero's Grave, though the skeleton farming method is much easier and accessible earlier.

While it lacks agility due to its size, it's a great shield to reduce incoming damage or block certain attacks. Moreover, a well-timed Parry can stagger most enemies and bosses, turning the tide of a battle. And if a player has a Talisman that increases maximum Stamina like the Viridian Amber, they can block more attacks.

But, despite its decent stats, other shields can get the job done a lot better, but the reason why Blue-Gold Kite Shield is among the best is that it's a lot easier to obtain when compared to the other shields on the list.

Elden Ring Blue-Gold Kite Shield Location

To get the Blue-Gold Kite Shield Elden Ring players must buy it from the Nomadic Merchant in Eastern Limgrave for 1000 runes. The merchant sits just out of sight just north of Fort Haight. For classes that didn't start with a 100% Physical block shield, it's an invaluable stop to make early in the game.

And the Visage Shield is a useful Greatshield since it not only protects players but can also spray several jets of fire from its front.

Moreover, players can use Magic and Consumables to buff Tongues of Fire's damage. But, players will use up FP while using the skill, so players do well acquiring the Cerulean Hidden Tear, which grants unlimited FP for a short duration.

Elden Ring Visage Shield Location

To get the Visage Shield Elden Ring players must go to the Caelem Ruins, just down the road from the Smouldering Church on the border of Limgrave and Caelid. Watch out for the Scarlet Rot-infested enemies whose instantly recognizable Pizza Tower scream signals they are about to explode. You will find the Visage Shield on the ground near the ruins.

So, the Marred Leather Shield paired with a Bleed weapon like the Uchigatana can prove to be a lethal combo since both pieces of equipment cause Blood Loss buildup.

To get this shield, players will need to take a secret entrance to Stormveil Castle, making it one of the earliest (and easiest) Status Effect shields in Elden Ring.

Elden Ring Marred Leather Shield Location

To get the Marred Leather Shield Elden Ring players must go to Stormveil Castle, then skip the main route by taking a shortcut offered by Gostoc at the gate. From the second Site of Grace, head up the wooden stairs and pick up the item about halfway up, before you reach the Exile Soldier that blows the horn, to get the Marred Leather Shield.

The Buckler is one of the best Elden Ring shields, but not necessarily because its good at defending. In fact, it has some of the least-defensive stats in the game, and hardly negates incoming damage at all. But that' because this shield isn't necessarily meant for defense, it's meant to complement your offensive capabilities with its improved Parry.

The Buckler is one of the few Shields in Elden Ring that gives a wider window for successful Parries, and makes it significantly easier to land a Critical Hit against enemies whose attacks you've memorized.

Elden Ring Buckler Location

To get the Buckler Elden Ring players must either choose to start the game as a Bandit, for whom the Buckler is given as starting equipment, or purchase it from Gatekeeper Gostoc in Stormveil Castle. Gostoc will only have this in his inventory after you open the main gate, whether that's by requesting his aid or by going the long way around. From Gostoc, the Buckler will set you back 1,500 Runes.

Players who enjoy rolling around and dodging attacks (which the Bandit class excels in) will enjoy using the Coil Shield since it's classified as Small Shield, making it lightweight. But, as one might have expected, this shield offers little to no damage mitigation in exchange for this light load.

Despite that minor setback, FromSoftware gave this shield a unique skill in the form of Viper Bite, which unleashes a viper that performs a bite attack on enemies. Moreover, Viper Bite causes Poison to enemy players, and at a rate faster than other Poison sources. For Poison builds, it's a must-have.

Elden Ring Coil Shield Location

To get the Coil Shield Elden Ring players must enter the Volcano Cave in Mt. Gelmir, just north of the Ninth Campsite Site of Grace. Players will have to navigate to a small room located on a cliff, where enemies will ambush them. Get past the ambush to find the Coil Shield on the ground.

But the reason why the Great Turtle Shell is one of the best Elden Ring shields is because of the Ash of War.

Barricade Shield temporarily increases Guard Boost and defense so greatly that players can deflect lethal blows and strike back with little to no impact on Stamina. Moreover, the Great Turtle Shell has a Passive Skill that boosts stamina recovery rate, proving useful against chain attacks. And the good news is that players can obtain this shield without fighting an enemy.

Elden Ring Great Turtle Shell Location

To get the Great Turtle Shell Elden Ring players must go to the Weeping Peninsula and head to the top of a tower just north of Castle Morne. While riding Torrent, leap into the Spirit Spring near the Castle Morne Rampart, and aim for the top of the tower instead of the cliffside. If you miss, jump down and try again. The Carian Knight's Shield is also useful for non-magic users for its notably high Magic defense, which can be great for taking on the Carian Study Hall and its Bow-wielding guardian.

Elden Ring Carian Knight's Shield Location

To get the Carian Knight's Shield Elden Ring players must defeat Carian Knight Moongrum, who is fought just before the Rennala fight in the Academy of Raya Lucaria. He's a tough cookie to crack, but jumping attacks and careful use of the nearby elevator to get him to fall are his weaknesses (a similar tactic some players use to farm millions of Runes).

Though it is outclassed eventually by lighter shields, more defensive shields, or more build-oriented ones, the Brass Shield can take players all the way through Elden Ring.

The major downside to the Brass Shield is its weight, taking up a huge 7.0 weight when equipped. Players who want to maintain a Light load should avoid this one in favor of a Kite shield.

Elden Ring Brass Shield Location

The easiest way to get the Brass Shield Elden Ring players can farm the Raya Lucaria soldiers gathered outside of Raya Lucaria Academy. Players can also farm Godrick Soldiers at the Gatefront Ruins and the rest of Limgrave, but they should only attack the ones carrying the shield itself. Despite having multiple drop locations, its difficult to farm the Brass Shield as it's one of the rarest (0.8% Drop Chance) shield drops in Elden Ring . But you will likely get one or more while leveling up and playing normally, considering the number of guards the Tarnished comes up against in Limgrave and Liurnia.

What sets this Shield apart from other Greatshields of its ilk is its use in the final battle against Promised Consort Radahn in Shadow of the Erdtree .

When upgraded to +25, the Black Steel Greatshield gains nearly 100% Holy damag resistance, which when combined with the 100% Physical resistance makes you nearly immune to Radahn's ceaseless attacks while blocking.

How To Get The Black Steel Greatshield

To get the Black Steel Greatshield, you must defeat the miniboss Black Knight Garrew in Fog Rift Fort, to the north of the bridge that leads to Castle Ensis.

The Dueling Shield is one of two new Thrusting Shield weapons in Elden Ring . That's right â€“ it's both a shield and a weapon. It doesn't have the best resistances in the game, nor does it deal the most damage, but it has a unique feature that makes it absolutely broken with the right builds: the ability to attack while blocking.

Like wielding a Spear and a shield, you can two-hand the Dueling Shield to be able to block with the left bumper and attack with the right. It has a sharp point on both ends, allowing for stabbing attacks, though it has a harder time against multiple enemies. Not that that's an issue when you can just hold down Block and retaliate.

How To Get The Dueling Shield

The Dueling Shield can be found in the Shadow Keep. Explore the Specimen Storehouse section of the Keep to find the floor with what appears to be a gigantic Deer-like creature hanging from the ceiling. The Dueling Shield can be found on a corpse in this room.

The Carian Thrusting Shield is slightly more powerful than the default unempowered Dueling Shield, especially for Sorcery builds that can swap between a Glintstone Staff and the Shield for different combat situations. The Carian Thrusting Shield deals split Physical and Magic damage (about 122 and 36 un-upgraded, respectively), and when wielded in both hands, it can be used to Guard while attacking at the same time.

This split damage means the damage ceiling on the Carian Thrusting Shield is slightly higher than the default Dueling Shield. However, with the right infusions and Ashes of War, the Dueling Shield has more versatility, and its lower WEight and only slightly lower defensive stats make these two new Thrusting Shields difficult to rank. In general, though, the Carian Thrusting Shield is more powerful than the Dueling Shield, but experienced players may find the Dueling Shield to be better with a high-level build.

How To Get Carian Thrusting Shield

The Carian Thrusting Shield can be found in the Shadow Keep. Go to the Storehouse Back Section Site of Grace circle around to the west on this level of the Storeroom until you see an alcove with a lone Fire Knight facing the wall next to an item on the ground. Defeat the Fire Knight and pick up the Carian Thrusting Shield next to this enemy.

Arguably the coolest-looking shield in Elden Ring , the Dragonclaw Shield is a fantastic greatshield that can block even the strongest attacks. The Ash of War is also useful during combat, especially for players who aren't good at parrying, as Shield Bash will push weaker enemies and stagger bosses.

The main benefit of this shield is its appearance, as its defensive stats are a bit lower than other greatshields. But thanks to its relatively low weight, the Dragonclaw Shield can free up some room in one's Equip Load for better armor.

Elden Ring Dragonclaw Greatshield Location

To get the Dragonclaw Greatshield Elden Ring players must defeat the Draconic Tree Sentinel, just outside the entrance to Leyndell. It's a tough fight, but fortunately, this optional boss also drops the Colossal weapon Dragon Greatclaw, a perfect match for the shield in aesthetic and play style.

The One-Eyed Shield is not only one of the heaviest things in Elden Ring , it's also got a unique Ash of War that turns it into essentially a long-range cannon. It is a Shield with great defenses (100% Physical and at least 60% for all Elemental types), but you don't wield this Shield for the stats: you wield it for the Flame Spit Ash of War.

When you use the Flame Spit Ash of War, your character will take a moment to set up, aim, and fire an explosive blast of Fire at whatever you are aimed at. It deals Explosive damage, knocks enemies away, and is incredible at long range. This Ash of War uses a ton of FP, so you won't be able to spam it. But there's not much you can do when facing off against a player with one of these in PvP except try to time your dodges and get out of line of sight.

Elden Ring One-Eyed Shield Location

To get the One-Eyed Shield Elden Ring players must defeat Chief Guardian Arghanthy in the Guardian's Garrison on the way to the top of the Giant's Forge in the Mountaintops of Giants. This optional boss is encountered at the top of the Guardian's Garrison, and will use Giants' Flame attacks against you. Once defeated, you should automatically get the One-Eyed Shield â€“ but be sure to loot the chest behind Arghanthy for the Giant's Prayerbook to unlock unique Giants' Flame incantations.

Additionally, players can upgrade the Crest Heater Shield with Ashes of War, arguably the best of which is the Barricade Shield ability. Whatever one's playstyle, the Beast Creat Heater Shield is a great choice, and it can be found very early in the game.

The Erdtree Greatshield is not only one of the best Elden Ring shields, but it also has one of the best Ashes of War. Remember the Tree Sentinel at the beginning of the game, the one that parried spells with a blast of Holy energy back at the Tarnished? That's what this Ash of War does, it parries spells â€“ sorceries and incantations alike â€“ and turns them into projectiles.

Some players have found a way to exploit Golden Retaliation with self-harming incantations like Fire's Deadly Sin, which sets a large area ablaze.

Though the duo technically both must die for the shield to spawn, one can be pulled off from the other behind the gate so players can focus them down. Either way, the shield only drops when both of the Tree Sentinels do.

item.title: Pokemon GO Player Evolves Shiny Geodude and Instantly Regrets It
item.description:
Summary

  • Shiny Pokemon can disappoint when evolving due to color changes.
  • Some Shiny evolutions lose distinct coloring, like Gastly to Gengar.
  • Researching Shiny evolutions beforehand can prevent disappointment.

A Pokemon GO player was lucky enough to catch a Shiny Geodude, but ended up regretting evolving it. The shift in Shiny presentations across evolutions has drummed up some conversation among Pokemon GO fans, with many sharing their own Shiny disappointments.

Shiny Pokemon have been coveted since their inception to the series, presenting a rare version of a Pokemon with a neat recolor. While there are no statistical benefits to having a Shiny Pokemon in battle, they're nonetheless sought out in every game they exist in, including Pokemon GO . For some fans, simply having a Shiny is enough, but others like specific Shinies in Pokemon GO because of their specific aesthetic qualities.

Such seems to be the case with a Pokemon GO fan going by Orcalotl, who revealed their disappointment at their Geodude that they evolved to Graveler and then Golem. The player laments that they didn't know that the color scheme of their golden Shiny Geodude would change and become so muted upon evolving it. The let-down is understandable, as while the Geodude has a pretty strong golden-yellow color scheme, the Golem is colored very similarly to its standard version, looking more brown than gold. Unfortunately, there's no way of undoing the process, so they're stuck with their visually less impressive Shiny Golem.

Pokemon Players Commiserate Over Shiny Similarities (or Lack Thereof)

Many other fans have shared stories of their own unfortunate Shiny Pokemon colorings. Some players have complained about similar transformations to Orcalotl's, like Shiny Gastly to Gengar. Shiny Gastly has a distinct greenish gas cloud floating around it compared to its usual pale purple, but it loses most of its distinctness as it evolves to become Gengar. Other players were upset about Shiny evolutions like Shiny Swanna, which loses the pink coloring that Shiny Ducklett has, or Shiny Blissey barely looking any different from a standard Blissey when Shiny Chansey had a distinct green palette.

Some may find the way that the coloring of Shiny and non-Shiny Pokemon and their evolutions differ as an exciting element, but others wish that there was a little more predictability with the way that the Shiny recolors work. As many indicated, the only way to avoid this situation is to look up what a Shiny Pokemon will look like before evolving it. While those looking to complete a Shiny Dex can still make use of an unappealing evolution, and a Shiny evolution may still have potential in battle, this can save a lot of headaches and heartaches.

item.title: 8 Best Launch Games On Nintendo Consoles
item.description:
Summary

  • Super Mario Bros. for NES was a groundbreaking launch title that revolutionized video games.
  • Super Mario World for SNES raised the bar with enhanced graphics, music, and levels.
  • Luigi's Mansion for GameCube brought a unique twist to the Mario IP and gained a cult following.

The most important part of any new video game consoleâ€™s release is arguably its lineup of launch titles . After all, consumers who are interested in buying a brand-new system the day it comes out need to know which pieces of software they will be able to experience from the get-go to justify their purchase.

Fortunately, Nintendo is very aware of this and, as a result, has made sure to always deliver high-quality video games that players can play on their systems from day one, whether itâ€™s on home consoles or handhelds. The Japanese publisher is renowned for its large number of excellent launch titles, so there are a lot to choose from, but the following games are the best ones in the companyâ€™s entire history.

Only one game per console.

Super Mario Bros.

Nintendo Entertainment System

Super Mario Bros. is undoubtedly one of the most important and influential video games ever created. Fortunately for consumers who bought a brand-new Nintendo Entertainment System on October 18, 1985, they were immediately able to experience this wonderful adventure, which finally showed the world that video games could be bigger and better than anything they'd seen before.

While the NES eventually became a successful console with multiple solid titles (including Super Mario Bros 2 and Super Mario Bros 3 ), people around the world still kept buying Super Mario Bros . years after its initial release, so it can certainly be considered the consoleâ€™s biggest system seller. However, this only applies to the North American version of the console because the Famicom had already come out 2 years before in Japan, so, even though the game was also very popular over there, it wasn't a launch title at all.

Super Mario World

Super Nintendo Entertainment System

After the huge success of the original Super Mario Bros. and the NES, Nintendo naturally began making sure that a Mario game would always launch alongside one of its new consoles. So, when the next generation of consoles arrived, Super Mario World immediately became the Super Nintendoâ€™s best and most effective launch title.

The Super Mario Bros series had been evolving with the release of each sequel, but Super Mario World was on a whole new level. The technology of the SNES allowed for more detailed sprites, higher quality music, more ambitious levels, and more complex power-ups (like Yoshi, whom Shigeru Miyamoto had wanted to make a reality since the first game). Super Mario World was one of the SNESâ€™ biggest system sellers, and it was the main reason consumers back in 1990 wanted to buy the console on its release date. On top of that, it also helped Nintendo to turn the tide of the Console War against the Sega Genesis and its mascot, Sonic the Hedgehog .

Tetris

Game Boy

As was tradition, the original Game Boy launched in Japan with a brand-new Mario game, Super Mario Land . But, not only did the rest of the world have to wait a few more months to experience it, people were also not eager to buy this new revolutionary handheld just to play Mario again. Instead, gamers were way more attracted to its simple yet effective pack-in title, Tetris .

Nintendo heavily marketed the Game Boy around Tetris back in the day, since the accessible yet addictive nature of Alexey Pajitnovâ€™s classic puzzle game was a perfect fit for the brand-new handheld device. The most fascinating part of this story is that the original Tetris was almost 5 years old when the Game Boy came out, and yet the portability of this console completely re-contextualized its appeal.

Super Mario 64

Nintendo 64

In the mid-to-late 90s, a huge shift in the gaming industry began thanks to the arrival of 3D graphics, and Nintendo was no exception. And, while it may have joined this new trend a few years late in comparison to its competitors, the wait was certainly worth it because the Nintendo 64 launched with none other than Super Mario 64 , which instantly became one of the most revolutionary 3D video games ever made.

Super Mario 64 did for the Nintendo 64 what Super Mario Bros . had done for the NES, as it showed the world what a true, fully 3D platformer could be, mostly thanks to the free movement that the consoleâ€™s innovative analog sticks could achieve. At a moment in history when everyone was interested in the PlayStation 1, Super Mario 64 gave them a reason to buy a Nintendo 64 on its release date instead (even though the rest of the consoleâ€™s catalog was not able to fully maintain this momentum).

Super Mario 64 DS was also a launch title for the Nintendo DS.

Luigiâ€™s Mansion

Nintendo GameCube

Nintendo took a big risk when it launched its sixth-generation console, the Nintendo GameCube. Instead of making a more traditional Mario game, they decided to go with something completely different: an adventure/horror game starring his brother, Luigi. As a result of this odd concept, Luigiâ€™s Mansion got a lukewarm reception when it first came out, but it slowly gained a huge cult following.

Nevertheless, Luigiâ€™s Mansion demonstrated that both Nintendo and the Mario IP could always reinvent themselves and shouldnâ€™t always rely on the same platforming formula. This game was brilliantly creative and unique (albeit a bit brief) and even though the GameCube eventually received a conventional Mario title in the form of Super Mario Sunshine , Luigiâ€™s Mansion remains one of the most beloved games on the console's entire catalog, to the point it even spawned two sequels on the 3DS and the Switch respectively.

Wii Sports

Nintendo Wii

The Nintendo Wii shocked the gaming world during the mid-2000s with its new and revolutionary motion controls. However, of course, the company needed to offer something that would let people try out this ambitious control scheme in a fun, accessible, and effective way. Thatâ€™s exactly why Wii Sports was the consoleâ€™s main pack-in game, a brilliant idea that ended up working extremely well.

Entire groups of friends and families could join together and play simple, but addictive versions of popular sports like tennis, boxing, golf, and more, all enhanced by the consoleâ€™s signature motion controls and charming new customizable characters called Miis. Wii Sports played a key role in the Wiiâ€™s monumental success, and it was so incredibly popular that itâ€™s the only exclusive that some people may have tried out on the console.

Nintendo Land

Nintendo Wii U

Nintendo Land may not have been as accessible or appealing as Wii Sports , but it had the same effect on the Nintendo Wii U as the consoleâ€™s main pack-in game: to show off all the fascinating new features of the eight-generation system in entertaining and unique ways. And, to no oneâ€™s surprise, it ended up working quite well. Maybe a little too well.

Nintendo Land offered players 12 different minigames based on classic Nintendo IPs, like Super Mario Bros , The Legend of Zelda , Donkey Kong , Metroid, and more. Every single game had its own unique mechanics and play styles, not to mention that they perfectly showcased the full potential of the GamePad, something that future exclusives tragically failed to do. Because of all of this, Nintendo Land is synonymous with the Wii U, even to this day. It literally can't be ported over to Switch (or, at least, it would be extremely difficult to do so).

The Legend Of Zelda: Breath Of The Wild

Nintendo Switch

After the release of Skyward Sword in 2011, Legend of Zelda fans spent years waiting for the arrival of the next mainline entry for home consoles. This game was revealed in 2014, and it was slated to come out on the Wii U, but it was delayed for so many years that it finally came out in 2017, on the very same day as the company released its new console, the Nintendo Switch.

However, this delay ended up being extremely beneficial for Nintendo, because everyone who bought a Switch on its release date could immediately try out The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild , a stunning open-world adventure with hours and hours of content, incredible set pieces and an emotional storyline. The fact all of this could be experienced on a hybrid console that can also be used as a handheld was nothing short of mind-blowing, and it greatly contributed to the eventual success of the Switch, especially during its first year. The only remaining question is: Will the Nintendo Switch 2 launch with a title as ambitious and impressive as Breath of the Wild ?

item.title: STALKER 2 Gives Disappointing Update on Potential PS5 Version
item.description:
Summary

  • STALKER 2's director confirms an exclusive focus on Xbox and PC versions for now.
  • The game's popularity leads to profit for GSC Game World, with no mention of future PlayStation plans.
  • The dev team continues to focus on bug fixes and updates, hinting at ongoing maintenance work over potential PS5 release.

Dealing a blow to the chances of STALKER 2: Heart of Chornobyl receiving a PS5 port in the near future, director Ievgen Grygorovych has stated the Xbox and PC versions are the "only ones" being worked on by developer GSC Game World. STALKER 2 is one of Xbox's major console exclusives of 2024 and is currently available only on Xbox Series X/S and PC.

Since releasing on November 20, STALKER 2 has hit the ground running, with its sales and player count soaring high within a short period of time. The significant demand for the post-apocalyptic FPS is also partly down to the prolonged wait for the game, which was originally announced way back in 2010. As a result of its popularity, just about a month after its launch, the STALKER sequel collected enough revenue to generate a profit for its creator, GSC Game World. Despite it being an Xbox console exclusive, certain players have been holding out for an eventual PS5 version announcement. However, such speculation may now have been put to bed, at least for the time being, by the Ukrainian studio.

Recently, Grygorovych gave a disappointing statement when asked about STALKER 2: Heart of Chornobyl 's potential PS5 arrival in an interview with Tech4Gamers. Going with a brief and indirect answer, he said that GSC Game World has been "fully focused" on first developing and now supporting the PC and Xbox ports. When the source explicitly asked about the rumored three-month Xbox exclusivity for the horror game and its prospects for a PlayStation launch, the STALKER 2 lead emphasized the team's policy of not talking about "leaks, rumors, or speculations." Moreover, he reiterated that the game's versions on its current platforms are the "only ones" being worked on by the developer.

STALKER 2 Developer Remains Tight-Lipped on a Possible PS5 Port

Evidently, the STALKER 2 director's comments hint at his lack of interest in talking about the likelihood of the game making it onto PlayStation. This suggests that things with the latest STALKER title are being handled quite differently compared to another major Xbox console exclusive, Indiana Jones and the Great Circle , which was revealed to be coming to PS5 even before the Xbox and PC versions were out. Given that the move didn't sit well with certain Xbox enthusiasts, there have been reports that the Microsoft-owned brand may have dialed down on making its big game releases multi-platform too soon.

Even if Grygorovych's team isn't developing a PS5 version at present, it is likely to have its hands full, owing to the maintenance work required due to the game's bug-laden launch state. Since its release, GSC Game World has shipped hefty updates to optimize the experience for players, with a recent major update fixing nearly 2,000 technical issues in the new STALKER game. Based on the dev's comments, it looks like more significant updates for the foreseeable future are the priority right now rather than any speculated PlayStation port.

item.title: Helldivers 2: The FRV Can Beat Exosuits to the Punch in One Big Way
item.description:
Helldivers 2 has entered a big period of change, and it's paying off in some big ways. The Illuminate faction, long teased by leakers, has finally arrived to threaten Super Earth, and it comes with a new urban terrain type for players to navigate. Perhaps most exciting is the new tool players can use to explore that terrain: the Fast Recon Vehicle, or FRV. A car has been at the top of player wish lists for months, so it's a relief to finally get a proper mode of transportation. It might get reckless Helldivers killed once in a while, but it's well worth it in the name of managed democracy.

The FRV especially feels like a long time coming given that players have had Exosuits available to them for a few months now. Exosuits certainly pack a punch, but they're not fast or nimble enough to really serve as transportation, which only further proved the need for a proper vehicle in Helldivers 2 . Now that the Fast Recon Vehicle is here, it also has an opportunity to top the Exosuits in a second way. Exosuits still only come in a couple very limited forms, but the FRV could easily pick up the slack in terms of variants.

Helldivers 2's FRV Needs Variety to Stay Fresh

There's no doubt that the Exosuits in Helldivers 2 are powerful. Heavily armored and unflinching in battle, they're both capable of shredding through the enemy; the Exo-49 Emancipator Exosuit autocannons can pierce through armor, while the minigun on the Exo-45 Patriot Exosuit is well-suited for mowing down hordes. However, since they were added, Helldivers 2 hasn't added more Exosuit types, despite the broad potential for variants. Anything from a flamethrower suit to a suit with double machine guns could offer some useful options, but these have yet to manifest.

The brand-new Fast Recon Vehicle is in a similar situation for now; there's only one type, armed with a heavy machine gun. Much like how Helldivers 2 sentries replicate all kinds of powerful support weapons, Arrowhead Game Studios could add all kinds of FRVs mounted with different equipment. Anything from an autocannon to an ARC-3 Arc Thrower to a missile launcher could prove invaluable when paired with the mobility of a car. Arrowhead could even add an FRV with an empty turret slot that players can lock their support weapons into, giving them a more stable way to fire off their heavy-duty gear.

Aside from variations on the FRV's machine gun turret, Arrowhead could also add a range of different car types without straying too far from the original design. Perhaps the simplest option would be a more heavily armored car that's a little slower than the original FRV, but offers more protection from incoming fire. Between the Illuminate's hordes of Voteless and the many smaller Terminid units, players might also get some utility out of an FRV with a spiked plow on the front to better cut a path through the crowds -- although it would stand to reason if they had to trade off some rear armor in exchange.

It's hard to say if Helldivers 2 will get more vehicles anytime soon, but there's no doubt that Arrowhead has opened the door for them. Even if it doesn't push the boundaries of vehicles by adding something like a tank or a helicopter, it can use the FRV as a baseline and add some variants over time. The FRV is great as it is, but there are lots of situations and missions in Helldivers 2 where a different kind of turret would be more useful than a machine gun. Hopefully the developer pays off this long-awaited new Helldivers stratagem by adding some more combat options for fans to plan around.
